0.question: What is the difference between an overlapping case and an error case?

1812.10735v2-Figure6-1.png: Overlapping case is an anecdote and error case is a miscellaneous <s>

0.answer: An overlapping case is when multiple aspects share the same opinion snippet, while an error case is when the model incorrectly identifies an aspect or opinion.

1.question: Which dataset has a higher proportion of sentences containing multiple aspects: Rest14 or Rest15?
1.answer: Rest14 has a higher proportion of sentences containing multiple aspects compared to Rest15.

2.question: Why do you think the performance of all models is generally lower on Rest15 compared to Rest14?

1812.10735v2-Table4-1.png: Rest15 has 13 aspect categories, while Rest14 has only 5. <s>

2.answer: The performance of all models is generally lower on Rest15 because it has a larger number of aspect categories (13) compared to Rest14 (5). This increased complexity makes it more challenging for the models to accurately identify and classify the aspects.

3.question: Which model performed best on the Rest15 dataset for binary classification, and how does its performance compare to the best model for 3-way classification on the same dataset?
3.answer: For binary classification on the Rest15 dataset, M-CAN-2$R_o$ achieved the highest performance with an accuracy of 82.14% and Macro-F1 of 81.58%. In comparison, the best performing model for 3-way classification on Rest15 was M-CAN-2$R_s$, achieving an accuracy of 78.22% and Macro-F1 of 55.80%. This indicates that M-CAN-2$R_o$ performed better in both accuracy and Macro-F1 for binary classification compared to the best model for 3-way classification on the same dataset.

4.question: What are the two main tasks that the CAN network is designed to perform?

1812.10735v2-Figure2-1.png: 1. Aspect-level sentiment prediction 2. Detecting aspect category <s>
Aspect Level Sentiment Prediction and Aspect Category Detection <s>

4.answer: Aspect-level sentiment classification (ALSC) and aspect category detection (ACD).
